sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: Ensemble is a music application. It is interactive and primarily MIDI-oriented, in contrast with Scoreplayer, which is non-interactive (except for tempo), and Music Kit Scorefile-oriented.
Ensemble supports NeXTstep Help. For detailed documentation, launch Ensemble and select Help? from the menu.
Ensemble is a multi-faceted program which can serve several functions:

listitem.para: Music Synthesizer: Synthesize notes on the DSP under control of MIDI keyboard.
Midi Sequencer: Basic 8-track MIDI recording and playback.
Sound File Mixer: Real-time multi-track sound file mixing and sequencing.
Signal Processor: Process sounds in real time throught the DSP.
Scorefile Orchestrator: Orchestrate a MIDI file or Scorefile, and save the results as a Scorefile, a Sound file, or a DSPCommands file.
Live Performance: Process MIDI input in real time in complex ways during live performances.
Algorithmic Composition: Create automatic and/or interactive compositions by using fractal melody generators and other algorithms.
Custom applications: Ensemble is a Music Kit programming example. Sources are included in the Music Kit release.

sect1.para: Ensemble is a document-oriented application. An Ensemble document represents a particular configuration of MIDI, DSP and/or sound file resources. The user interface consists primarily of the performance control panel, the main heirarchical menu, and one or more document windows.
To get started, try opening one of the example documents from LocalLibrary/Music/Ensemble/.
Some of these are algorithmic documents, others play back MIDI sequences.
